item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Hold fast to the diary from today on! Write regularly! Don't surrender! Even if no salvation should come, I want to be worthy of it every moment." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by صادق هدایت
item.description: "هرچه قضاوت دیگران درباره من سخت بوده باشد نمیدانند که من بیشتر خودم را سخت قضاوت کرده ام" -- صادق هدایت

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Happiness is beneficial for the body, but it is grief that develops the powers of the mind." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "It comes so soon, the moment when there is nothing left to wait for." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Every reader, as he reads, is actually the reader of himself. The writer's work is only a kind of optical instrument he provides the reader so he can discern what he might never have seen in himself without this book. The reader's recognition in himself of what the book says is the proof of the book's truth." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "There are perhaps no days of our childhood we lived so fully as those we believe we left without having lived them, those we spent with a favorite book." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The true paradises are the paradises that we have lost." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Proust-M
item.description: "Reading is that fruitful miracle of a communication in the midst of solitude." -- Proust-M

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "People do not die for us immediately, but remain bathed in a sort of aura of life which bears no relation to true immortality but through which they continue to occupy our thoughts in the same way as when they were alive. It is as though they were traveling abroad." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "What does your conscience say? — 'You should become the person you are'." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Man is the cruelest animal." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying. " -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Heinrich Böll
item.description: "یک چیز بسیار زیبا وجود دارد. هیچ . به هیچ فکر کن" -- Heinrich Böll

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Parastoo add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Women have served all these centuries as looking glasses possessing the magic and delicious power of reflecting the figure of man at twice its natural size." -- Virginia Woolf
